org.ggp.base.player.gamer.statemachine

Class StateMachineGamer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ggp.base.player.gamer.Gamer
      • org.ggp.base.player.gamer.statemachine.StateMachineGamer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Subject
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HumanGamer, KioskGamer, RandomGamer, SampleGamer, SampleSearchLightGamer

    public abstract class StateMachineGamer
extends Gamer
    The base class for Gamers that rely on representing games as state machines. Almost every player should subclass this class, since it provides the common methods for interpreting the match history as transitions in a state machine, and for keeping an up-to-date view of the current state of the game. See @SimpleSearchLightGamer, @HumanGamer, and @RandomGamer for examples.
    Author:
    evancox, Sam

      • getStateMachine

        public final StateMachine getStateMachine()
        Returns the state machine. This is used for calculating the next state and other operations such as computing the legal moves for all players
        Returns:
        a state machine

      • cleanupAfterMatch

        protected final void cleanupAfterMatch()
        Cleans up the role, currentState and stateMachine. This should only be used when a match is over, and even then only when you really need to free up resources that the state machine has tied up. Currently, it is only used in the Proxy, for players designed to run 24/7.

      • switchStateMachine

        protected final void switchStateMachine(StateMachine newStateMachine)
        Switches stateMachine to newStateMachine, playing through the match history to the current state so that currentState is expressed using a MachineState generated by the new state machine. This is not done in a thread-safe fashion with respect to the rest of the gamer, so be careful when using this method.
        Parameters:
        newStateMachine - the new state machine

      • metaGame

        public final void metaGame(long timeout)
                    throws MetaGamingException
        A wrapper function for stateMachineMetaGame. When the match begins, this initializes the state machine and role using the match description, and then calls stateMachineMetaGame.
        Specified by:
        metaGame in class Gamer
        Throws:
        MetaGamingException

      • selectMove

        public final GdlTerm selectMove(long timeout)
                         throws MoveSelectionException
        A wrapper function for stateMachineSelectMove. When we are asked to select a move, this advances the state machine up to the current state and then calls stateMachineSelectMove to select a move based on that current state.
        Specified by:
        selectMove in class Gamer
        Throws:
        MoveSelectionException
